Who we are?


Global Youth Network for Peace (GYNP) is a global membership association of peacebuilding organizations, professionals and a network of people developing processes for change in the most complex, chaotic conflict environments in Sierra Leone and around the world.

We are a peacebuilding Nonprofit-Non-Governmental Organization working with and supporting people at the heart of conflicts who are striving to find solutions to peace and security related issues. We work with them to deepen our collective understanding of the conflict, bring together divided communities and create opportunities for them to resolve their differences peacefully.

Global Youth Network for Peace believes that only by building a strong and active network of civil society organizations—each working across political, religious and ethnic boundaries—can a foundation for future pluralistic and peaceful societies come to fruition. GYNP works to reduce violence everywhere. Global Youth Network for Peace strongly believes that the use of mediation and dialogue in preventing and resolving violent conflicts in countries around the world is the key to creating sustainable peace. We are committed to the principles of sustainable peace building and development through enhanced governance for peace and stability, addressing conflict grievances and promoting conflict resolution dialogues at both National, Regional and Global levels.

The organization was started in Sierra Leone as Youth for Peace and Security Africa – Sierra Leone Network as one of the oversea networks of the Youth for Peace and Security- Africa to assist national governments and development partners to respond better to challenges of violence at national level.

In the fall of 2019, it became an independent organization from the Youth for Peace and Security Africa to better address the challenges of peace and security around the world. The organization transitioned from within the YPSA auspices to become an independent Non-Governmental and Nonprofit Organization. It maintains a strong link and partnership with the YPSA but now operating as an NGO. We changed our name to Global Youth Network for Peace to reflect the new scope and scale of our work.

Why are we taking action?


Global Youth Network for Peace’s mandate and approach to work is based on the fundamental belief that the use of mediation and dialogue in preventing, managing and resolving violent conflicts of all types in countries around the world is the key to creating sustainable peace and development.

Research has indicated that investing early to prevent conflicts from escalating into violent crises is, on average, 60 times more cost effective than intervening after violence erupts.

Violence causes more than 1.6 million deaths worldwide every year. Violence is one of the leading causes of death in all parts of the world for persons ages 15 to 44.

The 20th century was one of the most violent periods in human history. An estimated 191 million people lost their lives directly or indirectly as a result of conflict, and well over half of them were civilians.

Our Mission


Global Youth Network for Peace seeks to adopt democratic principles and inclusive solution-based approach in preventing, mitigating and resolving violent conflicts and build a world of hope for everyone, everywhere.

Our Vision


Global Youth Network for Peace's vision is to create a peaceful and developed world for everyone, everywhere!

What we do

We focus our work in these five areas:

  • Research

  • Educate

  • Advocate

  • Mobilize

  • Intervene

RESEARCH

Global Youth Network for Peace Conducts technical, multidisciplinary and result-oriented research on violent conflicts, terrorism, political and ethno-religious conflicts around the world as well as develop alternative methods of resolving conflicts of all kinds through research, education and training, dialogue and mediation, and rapid response to violent conflicts.

We create and maintain a global conflict alert database through the conflict monitoring networks, and develop new conflict prevention and resolution tools through journal & publications.

EDUCATE

Global Youth Network for Peace Nurtures and promotes a dynamic synergy among political and religious bodies for a proactive violent conflict resolution in Sierra Leone and beyond.

We organize peace education programs for students, youths and adults in order to strengthen peaceful co-existence amidst cultural, political, ethnic and religious differences.

We educate people about ethnic, political and religious conflicts through radio and television programs, web-based and social media forums, peace education programs, youth conferences, lectures, sports and artistic activities, peace exchange program, retreats and publications, and we train new mediators and facilitators through classroom and e-learning modalities.

ADVOCATE

Seeking and supporting legislations that support reduction of violence, addressing conflict before it escalates to violence, and ameliorating the effects of violence, we engage our network in direct grass-roots lobbying efforts to take peacebuilding to the center of national and international discourse and make it a policy priority.

We advocate for evidence-based peacebuilding legislations and policies that will enhance our capacity to reduce violence through prevention and intervention – building sustainable peace both domestically and internationally. We are working to greatly increase peacebuilding infrastructure and investment. Our advocacy to end gender discrimination in the workplace, increase youth participation in national governance and national budget allocation for local peacebuilding initiatives are a few examples of the policies we are championing.

MOBILIZE

We Organize mediation training programs for community leaders, religious leaders, ethnic group representatives, political parties, public officers, lawyers, security officers, activists, business leaders, women associations, students, etc. under unbiased, confidential, regionally costed and expeditious process.

We Co-ordinate the activities of and assists existing institutions concerned with violent conflict resolution in countries around the world.

INTERVENE

Global Youth Network for Peace serves as an independent platform for interethnic, interreligious, inter-community and inter-cultural conflict resolution. Our professional team is always ready to provide rapid response to violent conflicts for everyone, everywhere.

We provide moral, material and financial support to the victims of violent conflicts.
